verses.kjv: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
verses.web: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that LORD’s word by Jeremiah’s mouth might be accomplished, LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
verses.ct: During the 1st year of King Cyrus of Persia's reign, the LORD moved Cyrus's heart to action — fulfilling what the LORD had spoken through the prophet Jeremiah. Cyrus issued an official decree throughout his entire kingdom and had it put in writing:

verses.kjv: Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, The LORD God of heaven hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged me to build him an house at Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
verses.web: “Cyrus king of Persia says, ‘LORD, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he has commanded me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
verses.ct: "This is what King Cyrus of Persia declares: 'The LORD, the God of heaven, has given me every kingdom on earth, and he has appointed me to build a temple for him in Jerusalem, in the land of Judah.

verses.kjv: Who is there among you of all his people? his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of the LORD God of Israel, (he is the God,) which is in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Whoever there is among you of all his people, may his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of LORD, the God of Israel (he is God), which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Anyone among his people is free to go. May God be with them! Let them travel to Jerusalem in Judah and build the temple of the LORD, the God of Israel — he is God — there in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And whosoever remaineth in any place where he sojourneth, let the men of his place help him with silver, and with gold, and with goods, and with beasts, beside the freewill offering for the house of God that is in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Whoever is left, in any place where he lives, let the men of his place help him with silver, with gold, with goods, and with animals, in addition to the free will offering for God’s house which is in Jerusalem.’ ”
verses.ct: And wherever any of these people are living, the local residents should support them with silver, gold, supplies, and livestock, along with freewill offerings for God's temple in Jerusalem.'"

verses.kjv: Then rose up the chief of the fathers of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests, and the Levites, with all them whose spirit God had raised, to go up to build the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Then the heads of fathers’ households of Judah and Benjamin, the priests, and the Levites, all whose spirit God had stirred to go up rose up to build LORD’s house which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: So the family leaders of Judah and Benjamin, along with the priests and Levites — everyone whose spirit God had stirred — got ready to go and rebuild the LORD's temple in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And all they that were about them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, and with beasts, and with precious things, beside all that was willingly offered.
verses.web: All those who were around them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, with animals, and with precious things, in addition to all that was willingly offered.
verses.ct: Their neighbors supported them generously with silver vessels, gold, supplies, livestock, and valuable gifts, on top of everything that was given as freewill offerings.

verses.kjv: Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of the LORD, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of Jerusalem, and had put them in the house of his gods;
verses.web: Also Cyrus the king brought out the vessels of LORD’s house, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought out of Jerusalem, and had put in the house of his gods;
verses.ct: King Cyrus also brought out the items that had belonged to the LORD's temple — the ones Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem and placed in the temple of his own gods.

verses.kjv: Even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.
verses.web: even those, Cyrus king of Persia brought out by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and counted them out to Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.
verses.ct: Cyrus had his treasurer Mithredath bring them out, and they were counted and handed over to Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.

verses.kjv: And this is the number of them: thirty chargers of gold, a thousand chargers of silver, nine and twenty knives,
verses.web: This is the number of them: thirty platters of gold, one thousand platters of silver, twenty-nine knives,
verses.ct: Here is the inventory: 30 gold platters, 1,000 silver platters, 29 knives,

verses.kjv: Thirty basons of gold, silver basons of a second sort four hundred and ten, and other vessels a thousand.
verses.web: thirty bowls of gold, four hundred ten silver bowls of a second sort, and one thousand other vessels.
verses.ct: 30 gold bowls, 410 silver bowls of a secondary quality, and 1,000 other vessels.

verses.kjv: All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. All these did Sheshbazzar bring up with them of the captivity that were brought up from Babylon unto Jerusalem.
verses.web: All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand four hundred. Sheshbazzar brought all these up when the captives were brought up from Babylon to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: In all, there were 5,400 articles of gold and silver. Sheshbazzar brought every one of them along when the exiles made their journey from Babylon back to Jerusalem.
